moves.1. e4: Chess is mental torture - Garry Kasparov
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6: His King seems impenetrable. I had to initiate the attack
moves.15... Bb7:
He is too engrossed to gain a pawn advantage and overlooked my pending attack.
I guess he still feels that his King is secure
moves.16. Nxh6+: Surprise! A sacrifice to open his walls
moves.16... gxh6 17. Bxh6 Bg5: There is nothing more important for him than to get rid of my dark bishop
moves.18. Qg4: Which is also very important for me to keep the pressure
moves.18... f6 19. Bxf8:
In retrospect I should have moved h4 rather than capture the rook.
Perhaps I lost my nerves and wanted to secure a material advantage
moves.19... Kxf8 20. h4 Bh6 21. Rad1 Qe7 22. c: Now he is looking for the exchange to loosen the pressure
moves.23. Qh3 Bc8 24. Bf5 Nb6 25. Bxc8 Nxc8 26: Almost had a draw by threefold repitition
